' Reflecting Range Of Opinions ' The Communist Party holds 32 seats in the 450 - member Verkhovna Rada .
The majority of its backing comes from the southern and eastern regions that are currently in the grip of turmoil as the government battles pro-Russian separatists and militants .
With the collapse of the Party of Regions after former President Viktor Yanukovych fled Ukraine in February , the Communist Party is now the main voice in Kyiv of the restive regions of the east .
The south and the east are losing practically their last political representation , says Ruslan Bortnik , director of the Institute of Analysis and Management Policy in Kyiv .
